thread.title: Angola: Telecommunication Firms to Have New Broad Band Services
thread.title_full: Angola: Telecommunication Firms to Have New Broad Band Services

title: Angola: Telecommunication Firms to Have New Broad Band Services
text:
Tanzania: E-Technology Software to Keep Cattle Records 
Luanda — Telecommunication and Information Technologies minister José Carvalho da Rocha last Wednesday, in Luanda, announced that the three big telephone companies (Unitel, Movicel and Angola-Telecom) will soon have licences to operate fully in all the areas of the country?s telecommunications sector, for the benefit of the population. 
The government official - who said so to the press in the end of the joint session of the Economic Commission and Real Economy Commission, both of the Cabinet Council, which was chaired by President José Eduardo dos Santos - explained that the said companies will gain full intervention in the areas of fix telephone lines, mobile phones and subscription television services. 
He went on to say that these operators will need to have access to broad band telecommunications services, through the benefits of the digital system. 
"What will happen soon is that we'll stop having television and radio broadcasting in the analogical system and begin the digital one", clarified the minister. 
José Carvalho da Rocha further explained that this type of service will bring greater speed and better access to the internet system, which is something the public need. 
The mentioned meeting also passed the memorandum on the new legal framework for the licensing of telecommunications firms, among a few other juridical instruments. Angola
